alert.note: Alert for Adams; Franklin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 07 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Adams and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1230 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated persistent showers, some with heavy downpours. Generally, 1 to 3 inches of rain has fallen across the region since earlier this morning, with an additional 1 to 2 inches possible on a localized basis early this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chambersburg, Waynesboro, Greencastle, Guilford, St. Thomas, Carroll Valley, Fayetteville, Wayne Heights, Mont Alto, Mercersburg, Scotland, Rouzerville, Marion, Fort Loudon, Cashtown, Orrtanna, Claylick, State Line, Fairfield and McKnightstown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
